title: It's not equivalent to Haugsvar
text:
We needed to upgrade from our queen size Haugsvar (discontinued) to a king size and followed the recommendation that Vagstranda would be the equivalent.
It's close but not quite.
While it's comfortable once you're horizontal on it, the edges are so soft, i.e. no structure other than the foam and coils underneath, that you cannot sit on the edge of it. The Haugsvar was truly the better mattress.
I'm giving the Vagstranda only 3 stars for that reason, but if you're OK with the soft edges, it is truly very comfortable. 
I wish we could have kept the Haugsvar. 
Don't get me wrong, half of everything I own came from IKEA, and I have never been disappointed with the quality. Love the products. Love the space-saving designs. Just disappointed with this particular item's lack of equivalence.

More importantly, the mattress is¬†nowhere near as firm¬†as the showroom model we tested. It lacks support, and the surface feels unstable‚Äîmaking it easy to roll off. For a product marketed as firm, this is a major letdown and a potential safety concern.
Given that we live 2.5 hours away, returning it is inconvenient, but the quality and possible used condition make it unacceptable. IKEA should ensure customers receive¬†new, undamaged¬†products that match showroom standards. Would not recommend this purchase.
